website_summaries.verdict: A powerful disposal that can handle most garbage. The right pick for those willing to invest in a high-end disposal.
pros: Incredibly quiet with the extra horsepower to get through garbage quickly
cons: Slow to drain and some packages don't come with an electrical cord

website_summaries.verdict: The best garbage disposal available today. No other matches it in terms of quality, performance, and durability.
pros: No other disposer can match its raw power
cons: More expensive than other units, but its durability and top-of-the-line materials may save you money in the long run

customer_reviews.title: Pray your new unit isn’t defective
customer_reviews.text: Supposed to be a great product. New out of the box and worked for less than a week. Multiple customer service calls and Insinkerator gave me a phone number and washed their hands of me. Now dealing with local repair service who can’t book appointments until they’ve talked to Insinkerator to get a replacement. I’m going to be without a disposal for at least a month and have a feeling I’m going to get stuck with a bill. All. For. A. Brand. New. Product. That. Is. Defective. Worst customer experience ***Update 1*** 3 weeks in and the replacement hasn’t even arrived yet let alone managed to get a service visit scheduled. Never experienced this level of badness in customer service
customer_reviews.author: alessandro

customer_reviews.title: Installed and began leaking in two places within one week
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as part of a kitchen remodel project because I wanted a good garbage disposal. It was installed this month and began leaking in two places within a week. Unfortunately for me, I bought the disposal back in July, so cannot return it. I am beginning to rethink purchasing anything substantial from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: mdalum

customer_reviews.title: Solution to the rubber baffle issue
customer_reviews.text: I knocked this down a star due to marketing. 1) They don't include a power cord and 2) they designed the rubber baffle to make it quieter even though this angers most customers. The rubber baffle is designed to not let the water drain from the sink very quickly. This makes a water layer that keeps the sound from emanating from below. The water builds up in the sink and you get dirt rings on the side of the sink. When you force food down the chute the thing flicks garbage back at you as the baffle pops back into its normal shape. I fixed that problem by pulling the rubber baffle completely out and reinstalling it upside down.
customer_reviews.author: WarmWeatherGuy

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product based on awesome review. However my experience is; -- This product stopped working after one week. Not turning at all. I ended up buying another one from Home Depot. -- Do not buy applicances from Aamzon - return is pain. -- Save your money - avoid this product.
customer_reviews.author: NileshB

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, and quiet operation
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for my old disposal which had sprung a leak right at the electrical connection box. Although this used the same mounting system as the old unit, I chose to replace everything - drain, mounting system, and disposal. Instructions were easy to follow, and installation was a breeze. Removing old unit and installing new was under an hour. The disposal is extremely quiet, and performs exactly as advertised. Considering the danger of the leak at electrical on the old unit, the Amazon Prime 1 day delivery was a definite plus, and Amazon undercut local DIY stores by $70. Win-win.
customer_reviews.author: victor lucas

customer_reviews.title: Died under 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for a kitchen remodel but it claimed to be the best. After very minimal use it just died. It refused to even start. Can never seem to get in touch with the company so it seems like I'm going to have to get either a new one or something totally different from a company that truly stands behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: A. John

customer_reviews.title: QUIET
customer_reviews.text: RIDICULOUSLY quiet. It is actually so quiet, you might think it isn’t working but it is. We opted to have our plumber install it as I didn’t want to mess with any modifications to existing kitchen sink plumbing that might be necessary. Thankfully, there was enough room so no modifications were necessary and it was an uneventful install, but I didn’t want to chance it. Make sure you buy this exact model from Amazon, not Lowe’s, as the one sold at the latter is in fact slightly different (certain critical parts are plastic not metal...see other reviews for more detailed info).
customer_reviews.author: plastic dervish

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in 4 month, awful company service and taking responsibility
customer_reviews.text: The product get broke after 4 month of usage. Part fo the product disconnected and stuck the blaze. I have paid for the technician that confirmed it is product's defect. The manufacture company did not want to rely on the technician company we used and insisted me to order another technician that assigned with manufacture to qualify the defect. This is awful user experience and waist of customer time. I won't consider this manufacture product in future.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but Works Super
customer_reviews.text: My foodie daughter constantly complained about the noisy, wimpy disposer in her condo, which regularly clogged and simply wouldn't handle anything even slightly challenging. I hate buying useless presents, so last year I purchased this InSinkErator as a Christmas gift/replacement, figuring I'd kill two birds with one stone. The difference between the two units was amazing; this InSinkErator is so quiet you hardly know it is on, and it makes quick work of anything you throw at it. Now I have disposer envy. I should have kept this one for myself and given her mine.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Quite but powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is our second InSinkErator. First was in the house we just sold and was still going strong after many years. This purchase replaced a very loud builder's grade GD. This is very quite. This home is has open concept kitchen-nook-family room and the GD cannot be heard in the adjacent areas. Really powerful grinding. But will admit that larger items, like watermelon rins, go into the trash to keep the amount of debris low going to the water treatment. Installation of the unit actual is not bad, especially if you are a DIY'er. But be prepared to make some minor adjustments
customer_reviews.author: RDH

customer_reviews.title: Don't drop it on your head.
customer_reviews.text: This monster of a garbage disposal is quiet as a church mouse. I haven't fed it any dinosaur bones or broken concrete yet, but I'm confident it would do the job. Installation was painless, all the fittings matched up perfectly with my old model. As close to a no-brainer as swapping an appliance could be. I named him JAWS because he looks the the great white shark from the movie of the same name coming up from the deep to eat the girl.
customer_reviews.author: H. Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Factory warranty is better than third party warranties.
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet, no more difficult to install over any other model. If the garbage disposal you are replacing uses a normal wall outlet don’t forget to get the easy to install plug conversion kit. Also with the 10 year in home warranty that comes with this model don’t buy an extra third party warranty as they are all inferior to the factory warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Davis

customer_reviews.title: Installation nightmare
customer_reviews.text: You probably already noticed that you will also need to buy a power cord to install. Despite what the instructions say, you can't make a straight and square cut on PVC with a hack saw. On your second trip to the hardware store, you'll have to buy a PVC cutting tool. Spring clips instead of good fastener. Doesn't seem to be a replace fit with previous insinkerator....now have to redo pluming on another sink to have the disposal drain property. A day project for me or $200 for a plumber. The box even says "Easy to install". Maybe if you are lucky.
customer_reviews.author: BigMontanaEd

customer_reviews.title: It's so quiet we did not know if it was working properly.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time we actually shopped for a disposal rather than taking whatever the plumber brought on the truck, so we took the opportunity to get something better than a basic grinder. We love the fact that the Evolution Excel is so quiet. We did not know what to expect, and we are very impressed with it's quiet operation. The cost to upgrade to this sort of low noise performance was a tiny percentage of our kitchen remodel budget, so the extra expense seems to have provided very good value. We installed it ourselves. It seemed easy. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: mister sunshine

customer_reviews.title: InsinkErator Evolutions are the BEST
customer_reviews.text: Installed this to replace another InsinkEator GD that had worked faithfully for many years. This model does not come with a wire harness. However, I was able to pry the wire harness off that old GD and insert it in this new disposer. I used some tin snips and cut the bottom of the old GD on each side the harness. It popped right out. I cut/striped the wire, pushed the harness in and wire-nutted them to the new disposer. The wire colors were exactly the same, so easy to ID Hot and Neutral. The new GD is super quiet and powerful... good for another 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Soulcalsurfer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in every way
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and came with all parts needed. Unbelievably quiet and seems very powerful. I installed it easily myself. It is worth noting that this model is heavy so I chose to make a support stand out of an inverted bucket and some cardboard pieces to use a as shims. I positioned the disposer under the sink by setting it on the bucket and then just added more cardboard shims a few at a time to gradually raise the disposer into position. This relieved me of having to simultaneously lift the disposer and turn the connecting ring at the same time. It made installation a simple one person job!
customer_reviews.author: Careful Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Wow, amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought over a dozen garbage disposals in the past decades, and they are generally crap. I've bought good (not the highest end) Badgers and InSinkErators, and they all seem to die after about 5 years of use. Maybe that's just SOP for these things. So, I decided if I could break that pattern by spending 3 times more than I really needed to, for the best damned garbage disposal on the planet. I am not disappointed. It installed and works like a dream. Get back to me in 5 years and I'll let you know how it's doing. :-) I recommend this highly if you're tired of the SOS.
customer_reviews.author: Alpine Doug

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but you get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: We installed an American Standard disposal and regretted it almost instantly. It was noisy and did not grind up fairly easy garbage. After a week or so of that we decided we needed something much better and our research lead us to this fantastic disposal. No only did it install beautifully, but its quiet, and will grind up just about anything you put into it. This proves once more, buy the best, and don't try and save money on something you use everyday. And believe me, we would buy this product again in a second.
customer_reviews.author: JJP Sarasota

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Insanely quiet! The only problem, which was easily resolved, was that the rubber gasket that keeps unwanted items from going into the garbage disposal is not well designed. Water would back up into the sink because it could not go through the gasket quickly enough. I made some cuts with a pair of scissors, and the gasket works fine. The unit is a bit expensive, but how many times do you buy a garbage disposal?
customer_reviews.author: Steven Kirsh

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: We recently redid our kitchen, and wanted a newer garbage disposal to replace our old inSinkErator unit. This thing chops up whatever we throw in it (so did old one) but it's so quiet! We have a TV in our kitchen and every time we used to run the disposal, it would drown out whatever we were watching. Now, the water from the faucet is much louder than the unit itself, and we can hear the TV when cleaning dishes. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Drew E.

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed Product
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old 444 Insinkerator with this Evolution Excel model. Installation was very easy requiring no re-plumbing. Unit is so quiet you might have to peer inside the basin to verify its working. Strong, powerful motor chews through everything I've thrown at it without any issues. Only unknown at this point is longevity, but if the previous model is any indication I expect its lifespan to be measured in decades. Very satisfied with this product and the relative low price I paid vs other retailers made it a true value for me. Thank you Emerson for producing a superb product.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet!
customer_reviews.text: We did a partial "re-do" of our kitchen and a new sink and garbage disposal was part of it. We had a different Insinkerator model which was quite old and decided to replace it with this one. Also added a counter top button to control it. I did not install it so can't speak to the ease of the install (had a professional plumber do the work) but I can say that this exceeds my expectations on performance. It is very quiet! So quiet, in fact, that it's easy to forget that it's on. So pay attention and turn it off when its work is done. Hopefully it lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: N.A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Installation team can only replace same model from same company and will not adjust plumbing.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace and old, cheaper model. Installation team came and said they could not install it as this unit was larger than my current disposer and the plumbing would need to be adjusted. Said they are not allowed to adjust plumbing. They told me they can only replace same company/same model units. This was not clear when I bought the installation package through Amazon. Can’t comment on unit performance as it is not installed. Gave a 1 rating as a blank rating is not allowed.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works well but does not last long.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a home with this disposal. It is very quiet. Worked well. A year later it jammed and tripped the internal breaker. We could not get it to work. Without paperwork on the unit I decided to purchase a new one. One year later the new unit has done the same thing. Works well while it works. Not a reliable product.
customer_reviews.author: GeneM

customer_reviews.title: A Purring Piraña
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast that purrs like a kitten. It devours everything I throw at it, and asks "is that all you got?" Installation was a breeze that required no additional plumbing fixtures/or drain lines. If you have a standard configuration...including a dishwasher...it will install in minuets. Probably the most amazing thing about it is the low, low, low noise level...sometimes I have to check to see if it's actually on. Get this thing, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: popsmaw

customer_reviews.title: the best ever used
customer_reviews.text: this garbage disposal is the best I ever used. the 3 blades make sure all garbage goes through the pipe, super ultra quite, and anti vibration tech is awesome~ little bigger than cheaper models but my plumber installed without any problem. if you are looking for a garbage disposal, this is it~!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Analyzer

customer_reviews.title: Great disposal and easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is beefy and its well designed. It took about 45 minutes to take out the old one and install the new one. Honestly it wasn't at all difficult to install. If you are moderately handy, you can probably do it yourself. Its about 70% quieter than my prior disposal. Its pretty wide so be sure you measure your available space to ensure you can accommodate it. I added the air switch and it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: cg5000

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install; Except....
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an older model that was almost 8 years old. I had the same issue this time as in the past. The knock out for the electrical connector isn't punched properly. If you want to use a larger connector you first have to knock out the additional ring. No problem, wrong! This ring is typically pre-stamped; however, with both units I had to use a Dremel to grind out the break away piece. Don't use a screw driver and hammer; unless, you want to knock in the bottom plate.
customer_reviews.author: Carl William Sisco

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and easy upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Badger 5 that was working after 9 years but just so loud. Didn’t require any plumbing mods and I did replace all parts though I could have used existing badger 5 mount. The unit is bigger in diameter by about 4” vs badger 5 but overall install was simple. Makes a quiet electric hum when running. When I first turned it on the hum made me thinking the motor was stuck but after throwing some ice in and turning on again, that’s as loud as it gets. Rock solid well worth the upgrade, especially if you have an open floor plan and don’t want to hear disposal noise.
customer_reviews.author: enice

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with powercord
customer_reviews.text: greatly disappointed! Reported to amazon and they can’t help me because I had a professional plumber install this and Aimadi kitchen faucet and paid $200 and they won’t refund or replace unless I return it! The disposal didn’t come with a power cord and we had to look for one in home depot including some other parts that were not in the package when in the description it says it came with it!
customer_reviews.author: Morocco

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, as expected
customer_reviews.text: If you are replacing a current Insinkerator, this should be a slam dunk. The Excel is an upgrade, but the dimensions likely match an existing Insikerator. Beware that the power draw is rated at 10.1 amps. Be sure you have a dedicated circuit or combined with occasional use items. DIsh washer and this on the same circuit, well other than being against code, that could be just plan dumb, unless you have a 30 amp circuit,.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, but LARGE, costly, and not as quiet as you might hope
customer_reviews.text: It s a good unit, but not enough quieter than the next model down to justify the cost. This will depend somewhat on the trap configuration under the sink. if the sink and disposal share pipe ahead of feeding into a common trap, much of the noise will come through that way. Still a great piece of hardware so far. Just beware that it's HUGE and will almost certainly take up more space than whatever you're replacing. I had to redo some of the plumbing to accommodate.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: InSinkErator, Excel, 1 HP (with reduced price).
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to replace a 30 year old Moen disposal that still worked with no problems. This unit was supposed to be quieter and maybe grind a little finer. It is quieter, grinds ok but finer; who knows. This is a good unit to buy initially or for replacement if you are keeping the house as It seems very well built and should last. If you are not keeping the house, consider buying a cheaper unit as it is only a disposal and only you would know what you paid. Loved that everything fit including all the drain lines.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Best garbage disposal I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've had my eye on this one for a while. Finally when it came time to replace our old one we opted to go for the best there was available. So far it has not disappointment. Despite being a 1 hp unit it is just as quiet as our old .5 hp unit. Does great with the usual scraps but also doesn't seem to struggle with bigger chunks of food. So far still happy in the investment.
customer_reviews.author: TechnoNerdTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Quietness is great!
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be well engineered. It was to replace the builder grade disposal installed by the developer. This one is 10X quieter than the one replaced. Don’t know how easy it was to install as had it done by a professional. But, it must have been easy as he had it switched out in about 10 minutes. Our plumber also noted the reversing feature of the blades to reduce chances of getting stuck. He noted the blades are designed to reverse direction of rotation every time the switch is activated.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Searcy

customer_reviews.title: Premium product, I’m truly amazed.
customer_reviews.text: When this was installed, it replaced a super low quality/junky garbage disposal. I still remember turning on this disposal for the first time. I literally laughed out loud because it was unbelievably quiet. I couldn’t believe it. I tossed an apple down there and boom, hardly any noise, the apple was gone! I have Jenn-Air appliances and this fits the high quality class that I appreciate with my Jenn-Air. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Mia B

customer_reviews.title: Absolute magic!
customer_reviews.text: You know how I know I'm getting old? I am so ridiculously excited about this disposal! I brag to everyone about it! We have remodeled our entire house, literally, and THIS is the first thing I mention! No more clattering, no more water spitting back, no more shuttering counters! DO NOT DENY YOURSELF! We paired it with an air button installed in to the countertop and are very very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: T.Hyder

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! This was installed in August and it is leaking now. It is great when it comes to noise, it is quiet but I did read that if you use hot water when turning it on, it has a tendency to leak. I would not have purchased it if I had known that originally. Now I have to reach out to the manufacturer to get a resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended and quiet!
customer_reviews.text: My original garbage disposal died and was forced to buy another one. I looked over reviews and when through so many debating what was important to me. Finally decided on this one and so happy I did. It’s super quiet, for a garbage disposal and very standard / easy to install. Actually a little more easy that others in terms on connecting plumbing. I have 4 people in the house and a mother-in-law that throws everything down the sink so I upgraded the HP to this one and love it!! All around great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Olga Machrone

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy & Great Performance
customer_reviews.text: I was replacing an older InSinkErator disposal unit with this newer and beefier model. I could not be happier. The entire installation process was straightforward and made even simpler by the fact that I did not have to replace the mount already installed in the sink since the old unit was an InSinkErator as well. The entire installation took less than an hour. The old unit was noisy and vibrated some when it ran. I bought the Evolution Excel 1.0 model for the power and quiet operation and am extremely satisfied on both aspects. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A beast
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Worth spending extra. Wanted something that could handle everything, quite and not die in two years. So far so good. Install took longer than expected, not because it wasn't easy, but because I had to get the drain length right, had to run to HD a few times and had to go find a new air hose to match. HD didn't have the right type of hose so had to run down to True Value. Biggest thing with all disposals...do not put any type of grease down it and I think you will have one that works a long time. Otherwise you are just going to gunk it up.
customer_reviews.author: gatorNic

customer_reviews.title: So Quiet!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was renovating my kitchen and I realized my disposal was over 10 years old so I upgraded to this model. It is very quiet and the plumbers installing it were able to install this unit along with a new kitchen faucet in less than an hour. I can only guess that the mounting system posed no problems and it was definitely easy to install and saved me having to pay the plumbers for extra time. The new disposal issue quiet I have to listen carefully to be sure it's working.
customer_reviews.author: John Mount

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old InSinkErator 777SS leaked, it's last leak. I wanted a direct physical replacement to avoid replacing any of the piping below the sink that was just replaced due to a drain clog. I installed the new unit in under two hours and it fit perfectly. The old unit had pretty much rusted away and had multiple leaks. BTW, after install, make sure that you completely fill the sink with water and let it drain completely. This is the only way to ensure that the dishwasher connection is watertight (if you have one).
customer_reviews.author: iPhone user

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Robust
customer_reviews.text: This unit is several times more quiet than the one it replaced. So far, it eats everything I throw at it with ease. Installation was very easy. I did it myself. If this is replacing an existing InSinkErator unit, I highly recommend performing the installation yourself because you won't need to replace the part that attaches to the sink. You only need to swap the power wiring and twist the unit into place. The tool for the twist is included. You will only need a Phillips screwdriver for the wiring and two wiring lock nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Baby Jocko

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Challenge
customer_reviews.text: Any garbage disposal is a challenge to install if you are one person. It takes strength, hand-eye coordination and a little luck especially since you are working in semi-darkness. After six or seven "almost made it" went and got the car jack from the car and lifted it right into to place. Piece of cake after that. Runs great and does its job. Quieter than previous disposal.
customer_reviews.author: Verne

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Very quiet and no vibration. Power to quickly grind up virtually anything you can feed into it. Only downside is the high cost, but we cook and entertain a lot, and aren't planning on moving anytime soon, so it does and will get a lot of use. Although it's a great disposal, I'm not sure it would be worth the extra cost to people that wouldn't use it much and/or may move anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Ethical shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older badger unit that finally broke after losing a few rounds of 'lets see how many vegetable scraps I can stuff in the disposal' game my wife plays. So far this one devours everything she throws at it. I did have to reminder that the 7 year warranty is not a challenge. This thing is so quiet I have no problem hearing her comments about spending $300 on a garbage disposal while it is running. I have high hopes for this unit, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Bottom rusting out and leaking in less than 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: This InSinkErator garbage disposal is powerful and, except for the difficulty of getting food and water to go down the drain into the disposal without manually pushing it through the drain hole, has been a great disposal. Until now. Now the bottom is rusting out and leaking -- in 2 years! Not what I'd call a high quality disposal -- especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Julia B.

customer_reviews.title: The Right Replacement
customer_reviews.text: First off, this was a little bit of a last minute, immediate need purchase. It replaced a "builder grade" disposal that was leaking. So, we realized that pretty much anything at that point would be better. So, this is obviously awesome, so far. It's super quiet, even when destroying a corn cob. Seriously, the description said it could handle it so it was tested and it more than passed. It's rather easy to install. Though you will most likely need plumbers putty. We didn't have any but it was a quick buy. Anyway, it's quiet, simple to install and it works.
customer_reviews.author: KhouriTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast. And still very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I think this thing would almost chew up anything. Hannibal lector would've liked to have had it. And it's very quiet. A couple of times my wife is left it on not knowing it was on. I just wanted a garbage disposal that really worked, and chewed things up really really small. In this one does. It seems to start up slowly to, which many of them don't and they jerk the motor around. Overall I hope this is the last one I have to buy.
customer_reviews.author: M Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: It's big, It's a beast! It's pretty quite, quieter than our old Maytag unit. It has eaten everything we have thrown at it so far (6 months).
customer_reviews.author: Often Disappointed!

customer_reviews.title: What noise?
customer_reviews.text: I'm serious, all I can say about this disposal is that it's quiet. I mean compare to my old one this is like an electric car. I don't even realized the disposal is on, at least the first few times when I was so use to the old one. There's no way I would ever go for something less quiet than this disposal. Other than that, it's a disposal with very good horse power, it does what it needs to do.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Best Garbage disposal out there. Worth paying more
customer_reviews.text: Best garbage disposal for residential use out there. Have put this in multiple kitchens. Don't waste your money on the ones at big box store. This garbage disposal is larger and heavier than the cheap ones at big box which makes it a little harder to install if you don't have upper body strength
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Nice Garbage Disposal
customer_reviews.text: This is a good garbage disposal. Powerful and quiet. The one thing is that it can be difficult to tell if it is jammed or operating properly by the sound. The muffled 'grrrrr' it makes sounds very similar to other disposals when they are jammed. We always have to wait a few seconds to see if the water goes down.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Neumann

customer_reviews.title: Don't go cheap on tires, tools, appliances, furniture or glue.
customer_reviews.text: Don't cheap out on appliances you buy once and then use every day. If a good appliance saves you just 5 minutes per week of time and frustration, over its design lifespan, it's worth every penny. My personal golden list is tires, tools, appliances, furniture and glue. If you legitimately cannot afford high quality on these, buy high quality used. Statistically, you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Desperado

customer_reviews.title: Quiet running empty, loud with food in it.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this for about 6 months. Overall it seems like a solid and quality product. The most noticeable point we noticed is the variation in noise. We have a well insulated large steel sink. The first thing we noticed is how incredibly quiet the disposal is when you turn it on with nothing in it. However, when grinding any items, it has a loud grumbling sound. Way different than any garbage disposal I have ever heard. Not saying this is good or bad. Just a loud different sound that makes you wonder if all is OK or this is going to shake apart.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Shapard

customer_reviews.title: EXCEPTIONALLY QUIET !!!
customer_reviews.text: You don't have to turn up the TV when using this appliance! It is easy to install and fit perfectly under my sink even though it is a bit larger than the Insinkerator 444 Garbage Disposal it replaced after 17+ years of service. All changes in drain alignment were accommodated by merely adjusting the slip joints of the pre-existing drain. The Insinkerator Evolution Excel Garbage Disposal receives highest marks in Consumer Satisfaction. You may or may not need to order the optional Power Cord & Dishwasher Adapter Fitting.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald B. Higgs

customer_reviews.title: Bigger and louder than expected, but still good.
customer_reviews.text: Well, its huge... if you dont have a large sink, expect it to totally take over the cabinet beneath it. Somewhat expected for a high power, insulated model. However, it's not as quiet as I expected. Not loud, but certainly quite audible even when just spinning and not grinding. With that said, it barely makes any extra noise even if you dump a cup full of ice into it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim O.

customer_reviews.title: extremely quiet and septic tank friendly
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily, although I was replacing an Insinkerator lower end model. You could use the existing collar and sink drain assembly, but I chose to replace it. It is the quietest disposal I have ever heard and quickly takes care of everything we have fed it so far. Expensive, but the quiet sound and three stage grinding will hopefully be worth it. After two months of use, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Jorgensen

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an old noisy disposal. Unfortunately, I ordered installation through Amazon, but they could not find anyone in my area to install for that price. My best price for installation was $150 per hour with a two hour limit. Had some other little things done. It's a great machine though and I'm very happy with it, just shocked by the real price.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. T

customer_reviews.title: Works great, looks nice, sounds great.  Better than the Supreme SS/Prestige models at Home Depot and Lowes!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, looks nice. Very quiet. I strongly recommend you purchase the Excel over the similar looking Surpreme SS and Prestige models sold at Home Depot and Lowes, respectively, as neither of those come with the jam sensor. For the price, you should get the superior model. As some have noted there is a 1/2 second for the jam sensor to check the contents, but it's minor. Wish it came with power cord and dishwasher adapter but these are cheap (under $10) parts so not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The perfect garbage disposal!
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I'd get a little excited over a garbage disposal, but this is no ordinary one. It has a 7 year in home warranty for starters. The best in the industry. To make this short, it is simply beautiful, strong and powerful, and works exceptionally well at a very quiet pace. This thing's an animal and I love it! It will devour about anything you throw in it. If you use your garbage disposal considerably, this is a must-have and worth spending the extra money in my opinion. At first I was hesitant about spending so much money on a garbage disposal, but I'm very glad I did for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Worth it in a high end kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Yes it’s expensive but it’s an absolute work horse. Handles carrots and potato skins and apple cores no problem. I know it says it can handle bones but I’m not comfortable testing it out, especially given the price point. Super quiet for a disposal but there is still quiet a bit of noise.
customer_reviews.author: KristinaLove

customer_reviews.title: An Astoundingly  Quiet Improvement On My Old Insinkerator
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 20 year old Insinkerater with this Evoloution Excel model. The comparrative quietness was astounding. This unit was fairly easy to install after watching a few online "How to Videos". There is one video using a car scissor jack I found useful. My only minor complaint was the unit came with a small dent in the side, I notified Amazon and they had a replacement for me delivered in two days. Returning the damaged unit was a breeze, Amazon issued an authorization that I printed and had me take the unit to "Kohls" to box and ship back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Buck Peters

customer_reviews.title: Quiet Triple Grind Garbage Disposal
customer_reviews.text: This unit is equivalent to a top shelf triple grind unit sold at Lowes. Almost too good looking for a garbage disposal, and yes it runs very quiet.. We bought it at the recommendation of our plumber, since we have a septic system. He recommended it over a specialized septic system unit that injected some chemical into each grind to facilitate processing by your septic system. Who wants to have to buy, stock and periodically replace chemicals in a garbage disposal? Better to fine grind, which this unit is advertised to do. So far so good. A bit expensive of course.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for a quiet and powerful model.
customer_reviews.text: Bought and installed it as a gift for my parents when they're old "badger" finally gave up. Did a fair amount of research and this one has been chugging and chewing along nicely. Installation was pretty straight forward. 2/5 on difficulty of install (It's an electrical component that is used with water. Save your ego and possibly your life by hiring a pro if you aren't familiar with plumbing and electrical work). 5/5 on quietness. Can't speak for longevity, but a year in and no complaints or trouble. Used daily.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon K.

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally silent
customer_reviews.text: This garbage disposal is surprisingly quiet, so quiet you might think it is broken or not operating at all. Installation was fast and simple. I also purchased the InSinkErator CRD-00 Power Cord Kit (www.amazon.com/dp/B000BQWXG2)(ASIN:B000BQWXG2) even though my previous garbage disposal had a removable power cord. Complete installation took no more than 10 to 15 minutes, and the disposal works fantastically. I cannot recommend this model highly enough; it is worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Sagum

customer_reviews.title: SUPPER QUIET
customer_reviews.text: Box was wasted but works like a champ! Our kitchen is open to the living with the sink in the peninsula the old disposal would be used anyone in the living room could not hear themselves think! this new one is Supper QUIET! We have to listen to know it's on. Will done inSinkErator!!!
customer_reviews.author: DENNIS & PATTI PAUL

customer_reviews.title: Leaking from the bottom
customer_reviews.text: I got this model because of the high reviews. I had a kitchenaid model before and I never had a problem. I relocated recently and I purchased evolution excel, I barely used it and noticed that it was leaking from where the plug is. Very very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Emel Moonlight

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is much quieter than the cheap ones that most builders or landlords put in (because they are tightwads). I think the difference is worth it. It also doesn’t get jammed up with anything that I’ve put down the drain like raw carrot pieces or even chicken bones which were put in by accident by a house guest. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: High End garbage disposal
customer_reviews.text: This garbage disposal is high priced and worth every penny. It is so quiet and you will only hear a mild hum and no sink vibration. The insinkerator is heavy duty and does take a lot of space under the sink so make sure you have enough room. I was replacing an old insinkerator so it only took me an hour to swap out. This disposal has a 5 year warranty which is the longest of all the models. Very happy with purchase and ease of having it delivered to my door by Amazon
customer_reviews.author: John DTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great disposal
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT!! I have a well and was worried about installing a garbage disposal but will use something in the drain to help break up particles and the 1 horsepower is important for good grinding. Don't skimp on that!!! I have had the Insinkerator brand before. The best!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carole J. Magoffin

customer_reviews.title: monster of a garbage disposal
customer_reviews.text: I can’t say enough about this garbage disposal. It works FANTASTIC!!! it’s quiet, works well and looks good under the sink (too bad I don’t have a window so people can see it!) my older one was started to make noises, but still worked. I am SO happy I bought this monster instead of any others.
customer_reviews.author: So. Cal. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Amazon is fantastic, I returned it and bought another one the ...
customer_reviews.text: Quite operation. If you are not replacing another InSink brand, you will need plumber putty as the sink flange should be replaced. Also, they don't include the required $1 wire clamp. Mine had an internal leak, called the help number, over seas support where English is their second language, and after 45minutes, they agreed to ground ship out another one in 2 weeks even though initial Amazon order came in one day and they would not allow me to pick up the replacement unit at the local factory service center because the unit has "in home service" warranty. Incredible. Amazon is fantastic, I returned it and bought another one the same day.
customer_reviews.author: david p.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Unit, Amazing Sound Reduction
customer_reviews.text: First unit sent to me was broken right out of an undamaged box. Contacted InSinkErator through Amazon, and they fixed everything n 3-days. New unit was fine. Installed easily (used the quick connect with the 3-bolt tightening, came with the unit). This unit is SO amazingly quiet! I had an InSinkErator Badger before, VERY loud, this new Evolution Excel you almost cannot hear running. Truly a difference worth mentioning! Overall, good quality result (would say 'excellent', but the initial unit's return caused a slight downgrade), super quiet operation and very easy to install. I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Broken within a year
customer_reviews.text: 9 months in and it’s making a cyclic deep bass groaning noise. Insinkerator will send out a tech but I’m on the hook for the bill if it’s not a “quality” issue. $400 for 9 months. The cheap badger that came with the house lasted 15 years. FIFTEEN.
customer_reviews.author: Eggplant

customer_reviews.title: Great disposal! Super quiet and smooth.
customer_reviews.text: Kitchen renovation involved replacing sink - and I wasn't happy with the builder-grade disposal. Did my research, found this one to be the best for the money and I'm very happy with it. I was looking for Heavy duty and stainless steel mechanicals. This one exceeded my high hopes. Not cheap in any sense of the term, but I'm happy when I get the quality item I'm looking for. Highly recommend. NOTE: it does not include a power cord (pig tail plug). I ordered one separately - I assume that's because some folks hard wire theirs.
customer_reviews.author: sb

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet
customer_reviews.text: This replaced our old 1HP InSinkErator which lasted a couple of decades. This new model is very quiet and thus far works very well. Only had this for a month, so only time will tell about it's durability. However the Amazon chosen installer, said that the supplied product sink flange gasket was made of paper, and is a cause of leaks. So the new sink flange and gasket were not installed.
customer_reviews.author: Nami

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Does it's job.
customer_reviews.text: Thus is the quietest garbage disposal I've ever seen and Not heard. It is about as loud as the running water. Which is quiet. If I have to find one complaint it would have to be the rubber thing in the drain. You have to take a fork or something and literally poke things down. I really should have save the old one I removed. Otherwise 5 stars. Used it for 4 months now. Flawless so far. Going to get a more limber rubber piece for the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Toonces113

customer_reviews.title: Bought one, liked it so much I bought 2 more!
customer_reviews.text: Great unit - SUPER quiet, especially compared to the one I swapped out. Also let's you replace the rubber "baffle" without removing the unit, which is another improvement over our old ones (where the baffles got gross and/or crumbled over time). Install was about 1.5hr with a helper for the first one, maybe 1hr solo on the 3rd once I knew what I was doing.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Miller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product
customer_reviews.text: I never had nor installed a food processor before in my life ! I’m kinda handy but far from being excellent ! Well it was super easy to install, unit is working great, and it’s super quiet ! It’s been 4 month , if anything bad happened I would update my comment but so far so good (April 2020).
customer_reviews.author: P.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty standard replacement
customer_reviews.text: Nothing very unique about the installation - pretty standard. Not difficult, easy to understand. The real surprise is just how quiet this is. I didn't think it was working at first. but even with almost no sound it easily took care of the test items I put into it.
customer_reviews.author: Edo

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work long
customer_reviews.text: Had it in , worked for about a half hour, the stopped, just locked up. I checked everything no one could figure it out, Rest button a couple of time but still would not work. Sent it back for refund and went with another brand, hope I get better luck with this one. Waste King 1 HP
customer_reviews.author: SFC- Oxyer

customer_reviews.title: Good disposal, but water drains slowly
customer_reviews.text: This thing is quiet, powerful and works very well for its disposal work. The only issue that I have with it, is that when you just run water down the drain, it drains through this quite slowly. That is likely due to the gringing mechanism being so fine.
customer_reviews.author: S. Olson

customer_reviews.title: The best garbage disposal on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't need a new disposal. My Insinkerator from 14 years ago was working fine, but was quite noisey. With new technology comes new improvements. This new model is so quiet and smooth operating. Yes, you do hear some grinding, but nothing compared to my older one. I had a handyman install it for me and it took him no time at all. Just had to switch it out with the other one.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Newhard

customer_reviews.title: FABULOUS Quiet Efficient Quality 🤫
customer_reviews.text: FABULOUS!!!!!!!! This is the best garbage disposal I have ever owned! It is very quiet even with my stainless steel sink. 🤫 I would have purchased it months ago if I had known how delighted I would be with it. If you are looking for Quiet Efficient Quality, your search is over!!!
customer_reviews.author: Unbelievable

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: When I first had this installed I was not sure it was on because it was so quiet! It performs well and has handled everything we fed it too. I had it installed and the installer did not say anything negative about the mounting system or the installation process so I presume they were routine. I've had it for over a year and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: JNMNR

customer_reviews.title: Wonduerful quality
customer_reviews.text: Great product, well made and very sturdy. I replaced the same basic unit that was about 16 years old. The only issue I have is that it is rather heavy to try to hold while you try to get it into the installation bracket. In short, you really need two people.
customer_reviews.author: scot stern

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and looks very mean and sturdy! Grinds like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install for a DIYer. I think it’s quiet although I am not sure it is as quiet as others say. I haven’t had an issue with the water not draining properly like others report. There is a flange so yes that’s going to happen. You can always remove the flange but you will then see the grinder and risk some splashing.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastien Tournier

customer_reviews.title: GREAT DISPOSAL
customer_reviews.text: We had the 3/4 HP in our old house, which was great also. Decided on the top of the line for our retirement home. It works great and you can hardly hear it. The only problem is the weight when you try to lift it up. I finally got a car floor jack and that made it easy to install. DO NOT forget to punch out the dishwasher plug first (Like I did) or you will have a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Pattie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet! You barely even hear it running until you put something down the drain. I'm not a plumber, and I got this all hooked up and running in about an hour. Instructions were very good, just looked up some vids on YouTube to figure out how to remove the existing one i had in my sink.
customer_reviews.author: David Morin

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I just moved into a new house and replaced a disposal that was not very old. This one is a higher end model and is MUCH quieter. Not only that but it grinds up the food very well and better supports my septic system. I have a leech field and greatly appreciate the bits and pieces being ground up. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Todd B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Disposer
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic garbage disposal. Yes, it is expensive but I felt it was worth the money. It’s exceptionally quiet and does a quick, efficient job of grinding and disposing of food/waste in the kitchen sink. The only thing I had to do was I trimmed the rubber gasket thing that fits over the drain. The hole was a little bit narrow, but it was easily fixed.
customer_reviews.author: John P Atchue

customer_reviews.title: Insinkerator Evolution Excell 1.o Hr
customer_reviews.text: This insink erator works so well, its quiet, powerful and totally gets the job done. It took about 1 hour to install and does everything I need it to do. Looks good below counter and so far have had no issues with it. Got it for a great price on Amazon's 1 day sale day at an excellent price. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: VinceNaples

customer_reviews.title: GREAT disposal!
customer_reviews.text: I am a woman, and I am here to tell others that YOU TOO can install this yourself! My smaller Insinkerator had a broken blade inside, so I upgraded to the big boy. Swapped them myself after watching a few YouTube videos. This thing is SO quiet, it will totally freak you out! Works amazing, couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Opinion Mommie

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is surprisingly quiet. It will probably never stall. But it is expensive. It is big and will use lots of space under your sink. And it is heavy. I had to use my floor jack to install it. But I'm glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Corson

customer_reviews.title: A Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I basically like it. The low noise and high performance. The item was broken on the top portion bet I was able to fix it by tied up with steal wire and using it. Just did not want to return and receive a new one as many hassle. Other than that, I like it. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: David Lee

customer_reviews.title: Workes great and is super quiet
customer_reviews.text: We have had this disposal for a couple years now and we love it. The installation was easy and it runs really well. When the old one was about to die it was extremely loud and we decided it replace it with this one. I'm really amazed at how quiet it is. We were able to run it while the baby slept without waking them. I would highly suggest getting one and we will probably go with the same company again if we ever have to replace another disposal.
customer_reviews.author: Styme

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and Silent!
customer_reviews.text: If you want the last disposal you will ever buy, get this one! It is a powerhouse and will pulverize anything with ease - watermelon rinds, chicken bones. And it is soooooo quiet. I’m fact, when my plumber first turned it on after installing, he thought he had done something wrong because we could barely hear it. Can’t speak to ease of installation because we hired it out, but our plumber got it done in way under an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great Design, Powerful But Super Quiet!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a previous good quality 1 HP InSinkErator that lasted around 20 years. This one is a little pricey; you can spend less for other decent ones, but spread over 20 years, the incremental is not a big issue. Very good flex mount and drain designs and thick insulation result in incredible quietness when operating! Be prepared - this thing is a bit large and quite heavy, so there’s a bit of effort in installing, but well worth it. if you’re comparing and indecisive, just get THIS one and move on.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Segal

product_meta.title: InSinkErator Garbage Disposal, Evolution Excel, 1.0 HP Continuous Feed
product_meta.description: In-sink-erator evolution excel food waste disposer. 1 hp, dura-drive induction motor. 40 oz. Stainless steel grind chamber and components. Multigrid Plus - three grind stages let you quickly grind virtually any food waste. Sound seal Plus and quiet collar sink baffle reduce noise by up to 60% over standard disposers. Auto-reverse grind system feature. Jam-sensor circuit increases motor torque 500% to break through the toughest jams. Continuous feed operation. 7 year parts and in-home service warranty. Available only to Plumbing contractors. Time Rating: Intermittent, Lubrication: Permanently Lubricated Upper & Lower Bearings, MultiGrind Technology: GrindShear Ring, Soundseal Technology: Anti-Vibration Mount, Anti-Vibration Tailpipe Mount, Sink Baffle, Multi-Layer SoundLimiter Insulation, Motor Protection: Manual Reset Overload, Average Water Usage: Approx. 1 Gallon Per Person Per Day, Average Electrical Usage: 3-4 KWh Per Year, Drain Connection: 1-1/2 inches Anti-Vibration (Hose Clamp), Dishwasher Drain Connection: Yes. Product Dimension: Depth 9.0 X Height 13.5 X Width 9.0
feature_bullets: QUIET BUT POWERFUL: This innovative food waste disposal is the quietest disposal on the market, featuring advanced noise reducing, insulated SoundSeal Technology, and our exclusive, long lasting 1 hp Dura-Drive Induction Motor.

DURABLE COMPONENTS FOR THE TOUGHEST FOOD SCRAPS: This garbage disposal features alloy stainless steel components with our LeakGuard Liner for the highest durability and 3-Stage Multigrind Technology with jam assist to handle the toughest food scraps.

AMERICA'S #1 DISPOSER BRAND: There are more American-built InSinkErator garbage disposals in US homes than all other brands combined. A full line of models means there's one right for every need and budget.
FASTER, CLEANER, SMARTER: From meal prep to cleanup, InSinkErator helps make it fast & easy to keep your kitchen clean with our iconic appliances: garbage disposals & instant hot water dispensers.
A HISTORY OF INNOVATION FOR THE SINK: We invented garbage disposals in 1927, & we're the world’s largest manufacturer of garbage disposals & instant hot water dispensers for home & commercial use.
40-ounce grind chamber with galvanized steel grind system

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,278 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
